state: You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal! -= Corridor =- Okay, so you're in a corridor, cool, but is it typical? You better believe it is. The room seems oddly familiar, as though it were only superficially different from the other rooms in the building. You need an exit without a door? You should try going east. There is an exit to the south. Don't worry, there is no door. There is an exit to the west. > -= Corridor =-0/1
next_state: -= Livingroom =- You arrive in a livingroom. A standard one. You can make out a sofa. The sofa is comfy. But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of trash. There is an exit to the east. Don't worry, there is no door. There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, there is no door. > -= Livingroom =-0/2

next_state: -= Kitchen =- Ah, the kitchen. This is some kind of kitchen, really great ordinary vibes in this place, a wonderful ordinary atmosphere. And now, well, you're in it. You try to gain information on your surroundings by using a technique you call "looking." You can see a fridge. You can't wait to tell the folks at home about this! The fridge contains a white onion. You shudder, but continue examining the room. You can make out an oven. Hmm. You always thought you'd be more excited to see an oven in a room. You see a table. I guess it's true what they say, if you're looking for a table, go to TextWorld. The table is massive. On the table you make out a cookbook and a knife. You can see a counter. You see a red apple, a roasted green apple, a green hot pepper, a red onion and a raw yellow potato on the counter. You can see a stove. But the thing is empty, unfortunately. There is an open plain door leading east. There is an exit to the south. Don't worry, there is no door. > -= Kitchen =-0/3

admissible_commands: take green hot pepper from counter
